DOC.brief_summary: Efficacy and safety of Tandospirone combined with Atypical Antipsychotic drugs to Improve Cognitive function in Schizophrenia
DOC.brief_title: Tandospirone Combined With Atypical Antipsychotic Drugs in Schizophrenia
DOC.detailed_description: With atypical antipsychotics for the control group, evaluate cognitive function in schizophrenia patients with antipsychotics combined 5-Hydroxytryptamine 1A (5-HT1A) receptor partial agonist tandospirone
DOC.criteria: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental DisordersIV Edition (DSMIV) diagnostic criteria for schizophrenia patients. 1865 years (including 18 and 65), male or female. Treated with a stable dose of an AAPD for at least three months. Informed consent was obtained (if the patient is in the acute phase of schizophrenia, does not have the capacity, their guardians need sign informed consent). PANSS negative score ≤60. Combined AxisⅠmental illness other than schizophrenia; Taking a mood stabilizer, antidepressants, anticholinergic or anxiolytic drugs, and other drugs improve cognitive function; Suicidal tendencies; Have severe or unstable heart, liver, kidney, endocrine, blood and other medical disease patients Clinically significant ECG or laboratory abnormalities were Glaucoma and epilepsy; Unsupervised or unable to take prescribed medication; History of alcohol and drug abuse; Allergic; Pregnant or lactating woman; Patients participate in other clinical trials during a month;
